TopicTitle: Scott Manley reference in the admin building?

Articles.Content:
I'm sure this must have been mentioned before (but I couldn't actually find any threads on it), but in the 2nd tier admin building, on the white board there's a red drawing of a planet with arrows and the text reads "Get Manley here". Surely this is a reference to Scott, right?

[![cBizBWFl.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/cBizBWFl.jpg)](http://imgur.com/cBizBWF)

[![HHeJvxQ.jpg?1](http://i.imgur.com/HHeJvxQ.jpg?1)](http://imgur.com/HHeJvxQ)

I'm surprised I've only just noticed this, but then again, I only really upgrade that building because I like the tier 3 pond.
I always thought it said money.

I think it says money..

Edit: Got ninja'd! First time on forum for me! Yay! (First one that I noticed)

I'm pretty sure it does say money, but with a capital N.

Edit: Double Ninjas

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-13T16:24:43Z" title="06/13/2015 04:24  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 13, 2015</time> by Dres**
I think it says, "Maley." Doesn't it look like that is the case?
It's money. Think about it in context -- that's the admin building where they're concerned about budgets and PR.
hmmm, yeah I think you guys are right; money.

Well, as long as we're on the subject of references (and not wanting to make a thread for this particular one), is it just me or is there a KSP reference in this commercial?

[https://youtu.be/dBdbGpsYNjk](https://youtu.be/dBdbGpsYNjk)

At about 0:40, the Most Interesting Man In The World is in an orange spacesuit surrounded by graysuits.

> 
> Well, as long as we're on the subject of references (and not wanting to make a thread for this particular one), is it just me or is there a KSP reference in this commercial?
> [https://youtu.be/dBdbGpsYNjk](https://youtu.be/dBdbGpsYNjk)
> 
> At about 0:40, the Most Interesting Man In The World is in an orange spacesuit surrounded by graysuits.

well, he is grinning maniacally while the others look concerned

> 
> it says "MoNey"

Oh, I see. But what does the capital N mean?

> 
> Oh, I see. But what does the capital N mean?

The same thing as a lower-case 'n'.

> 
> The same thing as a lower-case 'n'.

Ok, that's a good pun. I more meant does it mean an acronym or something? MN.

Searched on google, and got Minnesota. That isn't where the kerbals launch, so I still don't know what it means.

EDIT: Wait, I know it! I searched for the coordinates of the capital of Minnesota, and I copy-pasted it into the search bar. Then, I got a twitter account named @WaverlySummer. I searched summer, and I got the pop song summer. That song is romantic, and romantic media gets a lot of money! I DID IT! I linked the capital N to a sensical thing! YAY!!! (Kerbals are not racist.)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-13T21:40:42Z" title="06/13/2015 09:40  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 13, 2015</time> by RAINCRAFTER**

I would assume capitalizing the N is to imply that whomever wrote that was in a crazed hurry and wasn't paying attention to the details.

A.K.A. he was a Kerbal ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Hey, Mans!

If you wanna send all your moneys to me - this guy - I would appreciate it.

\*off side\* Hey! Da Cheat! We're getting pizza!
Hint: Scott Manley is not a god.
It could be "Manley" in poor handwriting-- the "a" and "n" could share a side, with the "l" being connected to the slanted "n".

> 
> Hint: Scott Manley is not a god.

I politely disagree. If he could do a MÃƒÂ¼n landing with only his nose, then he must be a god. IN KSP.
Imagine if you landed at those places at Kerbin and you just heard an ear-bleeding "HULLO".
